#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk anaconda
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: anaconda bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The anaconda packages contain parts of the Anaconda installation program that allows reconfiguration and advanced installation options. The anaconda packages have been upgraded to upstream version 21.48.22.56, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1196721) This update also fixes the following bugs: When using the "part" command with the "--encrypted" option in the Kickstart file without specifying a password, Anaconda no longer terminates unexpectedly and prompts for a password instead. (BZ#1185466) The "timezone" command previously set the hardware clock to the UTC time. Now, unless the "--utc" option is used, "timezone" always sets the clock to the local time. (BZ#1194729) The "liveimg" command now properly ensures that file attributes for SELinux are preserved. (BZ#1196021) This update ensures that new network interfaces are properly recognized during a Kickstart installation, and opening a network interface no longer causes the installation to terminate unexpectedly. (BZ#1197960) When installing IBM Power systems guests using the libvirt library and the Kimchi tool, certain elements of the Anaconda GUI were not readable due to clipping problems. The affected elements were modified so that they are now properly rendered on the screen. (BZ#1212615) During a Kickstart installation, Anaconda now properly adds the RAID swap information to /etc/fstab, and the created SWAP partition works on the installed system as expected. (BZ#1234469) Previously, a custom .buildstamp file did not properly override the default one in the Anaconda installer. Now, customizing the installer using a modified product.img buildstamp works correctly. (BZ#1240238) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: Anaconda now supports creating cached LVM logical volumes and installing the system onto those volumes. Currently, this approach is only supported in Kickstart. To create a cached logical volume, use the new "--cachepvs=", "--cachesize=", and "--cachemode=" options of the "logvol" Kickstart command. (BZ#1120421) If the "inst.ks=cdrom" boot option is used and the Kickstart file is not detected, Anaconda now displays a prompt and waits until the user provides the file or reboots, instead of timing out. (BZ#1168902) Anaconda now supports the Network Time Protocol (NTP), which can thus be used for configuring the network time if the Chrony service is not installed. (BZ#1085013) Anaconda now retries to download metadata up to 10 times, and installations on unstable networks thus proceed in a more reliable manner. (BZ#1177366) It is now possible to configure an NTP server in the /etc/chrony.conf file during a system installation even if the "Network Time" option is turned off in Anaconda. (BZ#1197575) The "--mkfsoptions" argument has been added to the "part" Kickstart command. This allows users to customize the created file system when using a Kickstart installation. (BZ#1217110) Anaconda now properly uses the Kickstart configuration file located on devices labeled as "OEMDRV", unless the "inst.ks=none" option is used on the kernel command line. (BZ#1057271) The "reqpart" kickstart command has been added, which generates architecture-specific partitions needed for the Kickstart installation, such as /boot/efi for UEFI systems. (BZ#1164660) It is now possible for Anaconda to use the kexec feature for rebooting after the installation is complete, which makes the reboot significantly faster. To schedule a kexec reboot, use the "inst.kexec" command on the kernel command line, or include a "reboot --kexec" line in the Kickstart file. (BZ#1207747) Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
